person.persName: Lucius B. Desha (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and politician)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, politician. Mason County, Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Desha and Peggy Bledsoe Desha. Married Julia Ann Moore in Harrison County on August 9, 1832. Father of Joseph Desha, Ben Desha, and Julia Desha. Married Eliza Moore in Harrison County on June 9, 1840. Father of Ada Desha, Ann Desha, Lucius Desha, Cave Desha, Bettie Desha, Jack Desha, Claude Desha, and Fanny Desha. Served in the state legislature from 1844 to 1861. Delegate to the Democratic Party Nation Conventions in 1844 at Baltimore, Maryland. Member of the state Constitutional Convention in 1849. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Served as a brigadier general in the Kentucky State Militia. Delegate to the Democratic Party National Convention in 1856 at Cincinnati, Ohio. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned thirty-three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Arrested on July 26, 1862 for treason. Served as a prisoner at Camp Chase, Ohio from July 1862-November 1862.
